channel.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
channel.description:
Ok, so I am currently able to get all the object hook's values via reflection. Now for the next step, what in the necessary code in order to turn those outputs into screen cords for an object of my choice?
I took a look at a few other bots, but no reflection bots seem to have object clicking in use.
Any help would be much appreciated.

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:13, topic:214201”]Depth sorting?[/quote]there is already a list of polygons to be rendered, it is impractical though to search through it

maybe insert some code to store the id of the model that is on top and the cursor is currently over, sorta like the ‘get top text’ method but more direct

Read full topic

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:11, topic:214201”]you would have the problem of identifying if the face you are going to click is hidden inside the model, would you not?[/quote]its been 9999 since i have looked, but even if you are unable to determine whether it is on top, you can right click

Read full topic

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

you would have the problem of identifying if the face you are going to click is hidden inside the model, would you not?

Read full topic

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

RSBot uses the exact position of characters and players. No tile clicking here. We need to hook models though so we can click randomly inside the model.

Read full topic

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:5, topic:214201”]Would it not be best to find the actual 2D polygons in the object, then create a region of exactly where they occupy on the screen? Then based on that region’s size, number of vertexes and distance from the mouse pick a pseudo random point to click on it with?

Then again, I have generally been an idiot.[/quote]each modelled entity has a reference to its onscreen model, that is in screenspace, there is no reason at all to use it (other than ignorance, laziness, stupidity, etc…)

Read full topic

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:7, topic:214201”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=281852.msg2289442#msg2289442 date=1214079972]
I made a reflection bot, and it had object/npc clicking
[/quote]Got a link to the source?

[quote author=qauters link=topic=281852.msg2289522#msg2289522 date=1214083499]

Would it not be best to find the actual 2D polygons in the object, then create a region of exactly where they occupy on the screen? Then based on that region’s size, number of vertexes and distance from the mouse pick a pseudo random point to click on it with?

Then again, I have generally been an idiot.

That’s the idea yes, find the exact drawn model and click it.
Main reason most bots don’t have it, because it needs more hooks then the old way of tile clicking
I’m going to hook it though
[/quote]How would I go about the tile clicking way?[/quote]
Download rsbot and see how it’s done? Reflection doesn’t change the way how it’s calculated, only the way how the fields are obtained.

Or stop being a noob and start exploring the client yourself. You can find it where they draw the text above head.

Read full topic

[quote=“Rictoo, post:3, topic:214201”]I made a reflection bot, and it had object/npc clicking :([/quote]Got a link to the source?

[quote=“qauters, post:6, topic:214201”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=281852.msg2289519#msg2289519 date=1214083320]
Would it not be best to find the actual 2D polygons in the object, then create a region of exactly where they occupy on the screen? Then based on that region’s size, number of vertexes and distance from the mouse pick a pseudo random point to click on it with?

Then again, I have generally been an idiot.
[/quote]
That’s the idea yes, find the exact drawn model and click it.
Main reason most bots don’t have it, because it needs more hooks then the old way of tile clicking
I’m going to hook it though :P[/quote]How would I go about the tile clicking way?

Read full topic

every bot i have ever seen clicks things based on the tile they occupy, needless to say the writers of said bots have generally been idiots

item.title: Object Clicking via Reflection
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

probably because reflection bots seem to be written by people who dont understand bytecode,

when you understand bytecode, you realise its much better then reflection,
and when you do that, you look around the client, and realise how to calculate the main screen position from a tile,

therefore, reflection => author is dim => doesnt know how to find calculate main screen => reflection bots dont have object/npc clicking,

also i guess there are one or two people who think using reflection will stop them getting banned,

you click objects in the same way you do it in bytecode bots,

Read full topic
